metadata.title: USN-5357-2 -- Linux kernel vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that the IPsec implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly allocate enough memory when performing ESP transformations, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5357-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-azure-headers-4.15.0-1136 - 4.15.0-1136.149~14.04.1 linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1136-azure - 4.15.0-1136.149~14.04.1 linux-azure-tools-4.15.0-1136 - 4.15.0-1136.149~14.04.1 linux-headers-4.15.0-1136-azure - 4.15.0-1136.149~14.04.1 linux-modules-extra-4.15.0-1136-azure - 4.15.0-1136.149~14.04.1 linux-cloud-tools-4.15.0-1136-azure - 4.15.0-1136.149~14.04.1 linux-modules-4.15.0-1136-azure - 4.15.0-1136.149~14.04.1 linux-azure-cloud-tools-4.15.0-1136 - 4.15.0-1136.149~14.04.1 linux-buildinfo-4.15.0-1136-azure - 4.15.0-1136.149~14.04.1 linux-image-4.15.0-1136-azure - 4.15.0-1136.149~14.04.1 linux-tools-4.15.0-1136-azure - 4.15.0-1136.149~14.04.1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro  linux-headers-azure - 4.15.0.1136.108 linux-signed-image-azure - 4.15.0.1136.108 linux-modules-extra-azure - 4.15.0.1136.108 linux-signed-azure - 4.15.0.1136.108 linux-cloud-tools-azure - 4.15.0.1136.108 linux-azure - 4.15.0.1136.108 linux-tools-azure - 4.15.0.1136.108 linux-image-azure - 4.15.0.1136.108 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
